reviews.review:
Would be better with hats.
9/10

Killing Floor is a decent Zombie style game with a wide variety of character perks, or professions to choose fro. It also has a LOT of different maps to play as well as different difficulty levels to choose from. Killing Floor has well over 250 achievements to get, with about half of them being map based. So if your playing a map say, called Forgotten, you can play that Forgotten map on Normal for an achievement, then, on Hard for an achievement as well as Suicidal and Hell of Earth diffculties for achievements. Alot of achievements in the game ! The Character perks can be slow going, but its up to you to find a map that is easy to master and spam that map over and over to get your Characters up as fast as you want. Some are easy to do, others are slow and painful. You can set up a listening server and have up to 5 friends join your server. This will increase the amount of enemies that come at you, and having a strategy to ensure everyone lives all 10 waves, plus the last wave, the Boss wave. Killing Floor goes on Sale A LOT and you can get the Killing Floor Bundle for 1/2 to 3/4 off. 

I bought the Killing Floor bundle on sale for $24.99 and its worth the price. It has just enough DLC and maps in there to make it worth the purchase. I used to play just MW3, and this game gives me a break from the long hours of MW3. The typical Killing floor game lasts from 30 minutes up to maybe 1.5 hours if you choose 10 waves and depends on the difficulty level you choose. 

Do yourself a favor after purchasing this game and play it on beginner, solo. You can customize your settings making it easier to remember them all. There are a TON of settings. Set the important ones (especially quick heal) and leave the rest alone.

Overall, I am near/over 120 hours on this game, and its still pretty fun. I have maxxed out a few of the seven perks/characters to level 6 (level 6 is max) and it was a challenge for sure. Some level 6 characters will allow you to spwan in with a weapon and/or carry lot more weight so your weapon selection can do you wonders. The level 6 Medic, Support Specialist and the Firebug on level 6 spawn in with decent stuff. The others I am still working on.

Overall, not too bad a game. The only quirks I have about the gane is that the Listening server doesnt allow you to set a MAX PING, or easily kick problem players. They should allow for IP tracking, latency, and IP blocking for seurity and fair gameplay. 

If your looking for a Classic style old-school game that requires a lot of heads up, keep moving action, and has strategies like running to the TRADER to sell weapons that U have found/picked up before the last zombie dies, and then run to cover and come up with a plan of defense for 160+ zombies of different sizes versus 4-5 players, its a hoot, especially on hard, suicidal and hell on earth settings. I enjoy the game, and the duration of each game is just about right. I think you will enjoy Killing Floor as well !
Killing floor is fun and has so much replayability

Amazingly addicting if you have friends to play with. Still pretty great with the random people servers though!

Initially a very two dimensional game that while fun, lacked proper staying power, Killing Floor has grown as it's gone on.

The seasonal events and the relatively recent addition of a campaign have helped keep the game from stagnating and kept people obsessed with achievements coming back.

Not really a fan of their more recent DLC, adding weapons that tip the balance to favour players who buy DLC is not something I can agree with.

The game is only truly fun when you're playing with people who know their stuff, and who communicate and coordinate with one another.  Friends with microphones and reasonable Internet connections are what you need to make this game really work out well.

With the afore mentioned companions, it can be a fun game to throw yourself into from time to time, though a less tactical one than Left4Dead.
You're not actually killing f loors.

1 or 2 years ago and I would've called this the definitive zombie game of recent years, Call of Duty Zombies was lackluster in comparison and Left 4 Dead was starting to get bland. However in recent times Killing Floor has been slipping, with weapon DLC being the biggest issue and the fact that the competition has been improving.

However with that being said, I'd still reccommend Killing Floor as the co-op zombie game to get. The graphics, whilst not beautiful, suffice in the task at hand. A lot of weapons feel meaty with the crossbow being my particular favourite, watching heads get taken off with that thing fills me with glee. The plentiful selection of maps provide good variety and the varied enemies means it has a lot of replayability. Surviving a tough round makes my brain reward me with endorphins and the game rewarding me with LODS OF EMONE. The character DLC is a mixed bag, some of its worth it and some of it isn't. It can take a bit of trial and error to pick one worth the dosh.

Go on, give yourself a treat and purchase Killing Floor but be sure to make sure your friends have it.

on't buy this game. I mean, seriously. Don't. If you do, you'll never leave your room again because it's addictive as fukk.

It is funny to hear the American interpretation of cockneys and British people fighting off hordes of what I tend to call zombies but are in fact failed lab specimens. In my personal opinion it is better than left for dead as it had a tighter budget, offers more gameplay variety and has more gritty jagged graphics making it not only scarier but generally more fun I find.

Pro's:
Gritty Graphics
Perks
Weapons
Cockney accent
Workshop support
Gunplay
Boss
Wave based shooter
Different game modes 
Maps are generally interesting
Made on a solid engine
Fun with friends

Cons:
Overpriced DLC

Final Verdict:
Excellent squad based 'zombie' survival horror game to play with friends and perk system offers plenty of reason to replay along with workshop skins, guns and maps free for everyone. Rivals many big budget games in the same genre well.

9/10

Killing Floor est un bon jeu !

Le principe est basique mais fun des joueurs dans une map subissant des vagues d'ennemis divers chaque ennemi rapporte des dollars et a chaque fin de vague vous pouvez dépenser cet argent durement gagner.
Pas de réticule force le joueur a économiser un max ces balles en visant , un système de soudure de porte , un système de Perks a jouer selon les niveaux que l'on peut évoluer nous permettant de profiter de divers bonus tel que : Reduction d'achat sur certains items , plus de degats avec certaines armes rajoute de la rejouabilité et du fun.

Une bande son bien métalleuse correspondant bien à l'esprit du jeu , je tire sa bouge dans touts les sens !

On peut sentir la pression monté a chaque nouvelle vague qui ne s'est pas caché derrière une porte dans la ferme en priant dieu qu'on ne se fasse pas poursuivre par le boss ultime ;)

This game is everything anyone is looking for in an exciting first person shooter. I mean who doesn't love to kill zombies, and no just ordinary boring zombies; there are fleshpounds and if the name doesn't terrify you then you will have to play it to understand. Co-op is a lot of fun and there are perks that one can level up to make the gamer keep coming back for more. Not to mention a lot of dlc and free mods in the workshop. It's been a while since I have wanted to keep playing a game like this.

They were rite...they found me and I've still got hours til the sun rises or at least I think I do. I dont know anymore....They're getting closer and I don't know how long I've been fighting just...quickly send back up.. I'm running low on ammo and I'm running out of blood...

This game is a zombie fest killing bloodbath. Enough said, you're mission is to survive waves of incoming zombies (of different types) and trying to collect cash ($) to buy better weapons and ammo. However, the game doesn't offer more then this. This game is a good time consumer, but nothing else. After playing a few games, you get bored, only to come back and spend some more time on it. The waves are too small (only 10) and the zombie hordes are too small. (Where are the thousand of zombies incoming games?) The weapons and the aim/movement/graphics is great, overall this is a good value for your money and I would recommend it. But it isn't awweeeeeeeeessoooomeeee.

I'm back again, cause I have played some more of this game. DON'T BUY THIS GAME!
This game gotta be the worst game made in history, because everything you do, never get's saved. It's like you are wasting hundreds of hours into a game, for NOTHING!

There is such thing as "Perks" which you "Exp" Level up, but you gotta do damage or kill something, and you will increase your perk, well the thing is, after each game you played this perk status is never saved. So you gotta start over from ZERO. Time and time again begin from 0, and there's only a few private servers out there that keep your saved progress, but that's like 2 or 3 servers and is almost completely dead.

My score: 0 out of 10

With a name like Killing Floor whats not to get? you and a squad are sent in to various locations around London and the english contryside to kill hordes of flesh eating mutated specimens,progressing though each wave of blood-soaked carnage with the end goal of killing the end boss the Patriarch and hopefully getting everyone through alive.

 Gameplay is really punishing, this is not COD you cannot run off, chasing after that fleshpound without your team backing you up the rambo approch is not recommended or you will find youself quickly outnumbered.
 The guns act and behave rather realisticly and are all well balanced gameplay wise, even the starting m92fs beretta is really soild and can pop the weaker enemies heads with ease.

The classes are cool as well the sharpshooter for instance is more adept at using rifles and pistols while the berserker has an affinity for melee weapons  and the support specializes in shotguns, certain classes are more adept at killing the bigger foes while some are more crowd control, this brings a really cool team based aspect to the online multiplayer where the sharpshooters must protect the medic so he can heal the rest of the team and so on.

The music is epic for an fps game as i feel it really sets the tone and style of the game all the while enhancing the brutal combat as you mercyilesly dismember and decapitate hordes of bloodcrazed abomitations  its mostly comprised of metal and i really do wish more fps games had a metal ost epic!

But alas for all of it awsome things it does right there are a few lil imperfections here and there mostly in the voice acting,its not that the delivery of the lines are not bad nothing that makes me cringe anyway but i do feel that they couldve had the actors do a few more lines of dialog hearing "cant you see im reloading" spoken mutiple times really does start to take its toll after a while, also some of the perks mainly the commando feel a lil grindy at times but maybe thats just me.

in conlusion if you like fps game or action based stuff you cant go wrong with this game!
